metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15505 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
drivers/media/usb/dvb-usb/technisat-usb2.c in the Linux kernel through 5.2.9 has an out-of-bounds read via crafted USB device traffic (which may be remote via usbip or usbredir). It was discovered that the Technisat DVB-S/S2 USB device driver in the Linux kernel contained a buffer overread. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Setting priority to low since this issue requires a malicious USB device to be inserted into the system

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-166.195').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1096.107').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.54~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.66').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.50').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.67').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.30~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.133').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-166.195').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.54~16.04.1').

linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.30~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1128.136').
